info.name: JoaquinSaldana_REST_API_Usage
info.description:
This is the collection that runs a series of tests on the GitHub Gist API.  It checks for the following: 

1. Getting public Gists Returns 30 Gists (or more)
2. Confirm that user "wolfordj" has at least one public Gist 
3. Confirm that hen you create a Gist the number of Gists associated to your account increases by 1 
4. Confirm that the contents f the Gist you created match the contents you sent 
5. Confirm that you re able to edit the contents of a Gist 
6. Confirm that you can add a star to a Gist 
7. Confirm that your list of Starred gists is incorrect 
8. Confirm you can remove a star from a Gist 
9. Confrim you can delete a Gist

request.description:
Per the GitHub API,made a call requesting all of the public listed Gists and ensure the API call returns at least 30 results 

https://developer.github.com/v3/gists/#list-all-public-gists

response.name: 1. Getting Public Gists - Response

header.name: Access-Control-Allow-Origin
header.description: Specifies a URI that may access the resource. For requests without credentials, the server may specify '*' as a wildcard, thereby allowing any origin to access the resource.

header.value: ETag, Link, X-GitHub-OTP, X-RateLimit-Limit, X-RateLimit-Remaining, X-RateLimit-Reset, X-OAuth-Scopes, X-Accepted-OAuth-Scopes, X-Poll-Interval
header.name: Access-Control-Expose-Headers
header.description: Lets a server whitelist headers that browsers are allowed to access.

header.name: Cache-Control
header.description: Tells all caching mechanisms from server to client whether they may cache this object. It is measured in seconds

header.name: Content-Encoding
header.description: The type of encoding used on the data.

header.name: Content-Security-Policy
header.description: Custom header

header.name: Content-Type
header.description: The mime type of this content

header.name: Date
header.description: The date and time that the message was sent

header.name: ETag
header.description: An identifier for a specific version of a resource, often a message digest

header.name: Link
header.description: Used to express a typed relationship with another resource, where the relation type is defined by RFC 5988

header.name: Server
header.description: A name for the server

header.name: Status
header.description: Custom header

header.name: Strict-Transport-Security
header.description: A HSTS Policy informing the HTTP client how long to cache the HTTPS only policy and whether this applies to subdomains.

header.name: Transfer-Encoding
header.description: The form of encoding used to safely transfer the entity to the user. Currently defined methods are: chunked, compress, deflate, gzip, identity.

header.name: Vary
header.description: Tells downstream proxies how to match future request headers to decide whether the cached response can be used rather than requesting a fresh one from the origin server.

header.name: X-Content-Type-Options
header.description: The only defined value, "nosniff", prevents Internet Explorer from MIME-sniffing a response away from the declared content-type

header.name: X-Frame-Options
header.description: Clickjacking protection: "deny" - no rendering within a frame, "sameorigin" - no rendering if origin mismatch

header.name: X-GitHub-Media-Type
header.description: Custom header

header.name: X-GitHub-Request-Id
header.description: Custom header

header.name: X-RateLimit-Limit
header.description: Custom header

header.description: Custom header

header.name: X-RateLimit-Reset
header.description: Custom header

header.name: X-Runtime-rack
header.description: Custom header

header.name: X-XSS-Protection
header.description: Cross-site scripting (XSS) filter

header.description: Lets a server whitelist headers that browsers are allowed to access.

header.description: A HSTS Policy informing the HTTP client how long to cache the HTTPS only policy and whether this applies to subdomains.

header.name: Transfer-Encoding
header.description: The form of encoding used to safely transfer the entity to the user. Currently defined methods are: chunked, compress, deflate, gzip, identity.

header.name: Vary
header.description: Tells downstream proxies how to match future request headers to decide whether the cached response can be used rather than requesting a fresh one from the origin server.

header.name: X-Content-Type-Options
header.description: The only defined value, "nosniff", prevents Internet Explorer from MIME-sniffing a response away from the declared content-type

header.name: X-Frame-Options
header.description: Clickjacking protection: "deny" - no rendering within a frame, "sameorigin" - no rendering if origin mismatch
